text: Gary Andrew Naysmith (born 16 November 1978) is a Scottish football coach and former player, who is currently the manager of Scottish League Two side Stenhousemuir. ==Career statistics== ===Club=== Club Season League National cup League cup Other Total Division Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Heart of Midlothian 1995–96 Scottish Premier Division 1 0 0 0 0 0 — 1 0 1996–97 Scottish Premier Division 10 0 1 0 1 0 0 0 12 0 1997–98 Scottish Premier Division 16 2 5 0 0 0 — 21 2 1998–99 Scottish Premier League 26 0 1 0 2 0 3 0 32 0 1999–2000 Scottish Premier League 34 1 3 0 2 0 — 39 1 2000–01 Scottish Premier League 9 0 0 0 1 1 4 0 14 1 Total 96 3 10 0 6 1 7 0 119 4 Everton 2000–01 Premier League 20 2 1 0 0 0 — 21 2 2001–02 Premier League 24 0 4 0 0 0 — 28 0 2002–03 Premier League 28 1 1 0 3 1 — 32 2 2003–04 Premier League 29 2 3 0 2 0 — 34 2 2004–05 Premier League 11 0 3 0 1 0 — 15 0 2005–06 Premier League 7 0 1 0 0 0 0 0 8 0 2006–07 Premier League 15 1 1 0 1 0 — 17 1 Total 134 6 14 0 7 1 0 0 155 7 Sheffield United 2007–08 Championship 38 0 3 0 2 0 — 43 0 2008–09 Championship 39 0 3 0 1 0 0 0 43 0 2009–10 Championship 2 0 0 0 0 0 — 2 0 Total 79 0 6 0 3 0 0 0 88 0 Huddersfield Town 2010–11 League One 14 0 0 0 2 0 3 0 19 0 2011–12 League One 22 0 1 0 2 0 1 0 26 0 Total 36 0 1 0 4 0 4 0 45 0 Aberdeen 2012–13 Scottish Premier League 9 0 0 0 2 0 – 11 0 East Fife 2013–14 Scottish League One 10 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 10 0 2014–15 Scottish League Two 21 0 1 0 0 0 0 0 22 0 2015–16 Scottish League Two 29 0 2 0 2 0 0 0 33 0 2016–17 Scottish League One 12 0 1 0 4 0 2 0 19 0 Total 72 0 4 0 6 0 2 0 84 0 Career total 426 9 35 0 28 2 13 0 502 11 ===International=== Scotland Scotland Scotland Year Apps Goals 2000 4 0 2001 2 0 2002 3 1 2003 12 0 2004 6 0 2005 1 0 2006 4 0 2007 6 0 2008 6 0 2009 2 0 Total 46 1 International goals :Scores and results list Scotland's goal tally first. # Date Venue Opponent Result Competition 1\. 12 October 2002 Laugardalsvöllur Reykjavík, Iceland 2–0 UEFA Euro 2004 qualifying ===Managerial record=== As of match played 20 April 2024 Managerial record by team and tenure Team Nat From To Record East Fife 28 November 2013 3 December 2016 Queen of the South 3 December 2016 4 May 2019 Edinburgh City 9 March 2021 17 March 2022 Stenhousemuir 3 January 2023 Total Total Total Total * Edinburgh City statistics include forfeit win over Falkirk in the Scottish League Cup on 21 July 2021. * Initially caretaker of East Fife and appointed permanently on 18 December 2013. ==Honours== ===Player=== Heart of Midlothian *Scottish Cup: 1997–98 Huddersfield Town *Football League One play-offs: 2012 East Fife *Scottish League Two: 2015–16 Scotland *Kirin Cup: 2006 ===Manager=== East Fife *Scottish League Two: 2015–16 Stenhousemuir *Scottish League Two: 2023–24 ==References== Category:1978 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Edinburgh Category:Huddersfield Town A.F.C. players Category:Premier League players Category:Everton F.C. players Category:Sheffield United F.C. players Category:Scottish football managers
